page.title: 10Shiskine Hill Fire Disaster
page.content: On Thursday{25 April 1985}almost {a hundred acres of young trees}were burned to the ground.Farmer Jack Murchie was burning heather up the hill behind Kilpatrick .Fire engines from Blackwaterfoot,Lamlash, Corriecravie and Brodick arrived at the scene.With around fifty beaters there.Two fire engines from the mainland were called over to the fire.A helicopter was reported to have been standing by.The cost of replacement was estimated to be around forty thousand pounds.This was the first time ever that a fire brigade has been brought across from the mainland.At six o'clock that evening the fire hit a wet area.Firemen stayed there until nine o'clock to make sure that the fire was completely out. Firemen were very pleased when the fire went out.
